com.versant
Class Launch

java.lang.Object
  com.versant.Launch

public class Launch
extends java.lang.Object

The com.versant.Launch utility executes a JVI application, enhancing classes "on the fly" using a Java classloader. It is intended to be an alternative to explicitly enhancing class files using the com.versant.Enhance utility. Using the Launch utility can simplify development, especially when using an integrated development environment.

java com.versant.Launch -config config-file [-puretransient]

[-manualdirty] class [arg1 arg2 ...]

-config config-file

    Specifies the name (with path) of the configuration file used in enhancing classes.
-manualdirty
    Turns off transparent dirtying with SCOs.
-puretransient
    For all persistent classes that are enhanced, fields marked with the Java transient keyword will be pure transient attributes rather than the default computed transient.
class

    The Java class containing the static main method to be executed.

arg1 arg2 . . .

    Optional arguments to the Java application. These are passed to the static main method.
